metadata.Title: CVE-2020-17482 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An issue has been found in PowerDNS Authoritative Server before 4.3.1 where an authorized user with the ability to insert crafted records into a zone might be able to leak the content of uninitialized memory.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2020-17482` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

pdns-backend-bind - 4.3.1-1
pdns-backend-geoip - 4.3.1-1
pdns-backend-ldap - 4.3.1-1
pdns-backend-lmdb - 4.3.1-1
pdns-backend-lua2 - 4.3.1-1
pdns-backend-mysql - 4.3.1-1
pdns-backend-odbc - 4.3.1-1
pdns-backend-pgsql - 4.3.1-1
pdns-backend-pipe - 4.3.1-1
pdns-backend-remote - 4.3.1-1
pdns-backend-sqlite3 - 4.3.1-1
pdns-backend-tinydns - 4.3.1-1
pdns-ixfrdist - 4.3.1-1
pdns-server - 4.3.1-1
pdns-tools - 4.3.1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: pdns package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.3.1-1').
